page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: Traditionally very small farms with the North Devon ruby red all-purpose cattle, a few pigs, and the farmer's wife keeping some poultry. This was hard work for the family but provided a good living, and the wife had the "perks" from her weekly stall in Bideford market. Since the last war the introduction of machinery, modern methods and fierce competition, have forced many out of business. The successful farmers have survived by enlarging their property up to l000 acres, either by buying adjoining farms or not renewing tenancies when they fall vacant. This trend is continuing. The EEC milk quota has caused problems, but grass and cattle will always be the major products.
